channel.title: Obama
channel.description: Obama said he would lower the gas prices not raise them up higher. and whats this obama care, seriously... That's retarded the illegal immigrants come here and dont work and get stuff but then other people that work dont get anything how messed up is that seriously. Obama is the worst president ever and he's going to stay like that. Obama is actually like Osama because hes like destroying the country.

item.title: Obama
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

First your gas prices isn’t high, move to Turkey if you want something to complain about.
Second, your current health care system is expensive and inefficient.

Would you like a simple solution to the oil problem?
Make oil the property of the government and just let governmental organizations drill for it (Of course you are creating one, and it will be easy to get workers since there isn’t any other companies on the marked). Only then you could take it out of the marked and only then a president could promise to lower the already ridiculous low prices. With global warming, high gas prices is actually good, this forces people to think more about the environment and either drive less or get more efficient cars. As technology brings the fuel-efficiency up, the actual price of driving goes down.

Back to your health-care: Just look at any other industrialized country and you would see a better system. The main problem with insurance is that the companies require profits. By cutting of the middle man you easily would save money, and you wouldn’t be denied health-care if the government did its job.

To all small government supporters:

Read full topic

item.title: Obama
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“R.I.P RSC, post:9, topic:440525”][quote author=Niall link=topic=543205.msg3981127#msg3981127 date=1335283069]
and I forgot to mention, just to point out some hypocrisy of right wing positions, if the us allowed drilling domestically who would do it?
[/quote]

Drilling domestically doesn’t really matter, unless the US decided to close their market to the rest of the world. The oil market is the most globalized market there is, and the prices are set globally. The government can raise the price through various forms of taxation, but I doubt the US has any form of gas tax other than the normal consumption tax.[/quote]
different states do iirc

Read full topic

item.title: Obama
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

and I forgot to mention, just to point out some hypocrisy of right wing positions, if the us allowed drilling domestically who would do it? it wouldn’t be the government, it would be private companies, and what are the private companies going to do with all that profit? and what does the right wing want, less government power, and less government power = private companies keep all the profits which a small part goes to the right wing for helping them make so much money in the first place

inb4 frell and/or “democrats take money too”, it just so happens that the right wing and republicans are the ones barking for smaller government and less government power, it’s a right wing thing by nature but it doesn’t necessarily mean it’s only the right wing jumping on the band wagon

Read full topic

item.title: Obama
item.dc:creator: @RDG RDG
item.description:
@RDG wrote:

[quote=“R.I.P RSC, post:3, topic:440525”]You seem to be under the assumption that the president of the US dictates the gas price. You seem to forget that the US is a country with a free market, which means that the price of commodities are set on the market. The price is a result of supply and demand. You live in a country where about 50% of it’s population sees this president as a socialist traitor. Socialism means a big government, socialism means that the government has a big(er) influence in the market. So if Obama ever said he would lower the gas prices, then he was lying. Any human being capable of reasoning should be able to figure that out himself.

I’m not a citizen of the US, so I don’t know all the ins and outs of Obama care. From what I understand of it, the government competes with other insurance companies, and everyone is forced to have a health insurance. I don’t know if that includes illegal citizens. Besides, you should see health care and illegality as to seperate things. The humane thing to do is taking care of anyone who needs health care, without checking if that person is a legal citizen.[/quote]
Yeah I heard when he was getting elected he was saying on the news “I promise I will Lower the price of gas” or something like that so, the gas prices are going up like 3c where I live its going up everyday. So I can’t drive anywhere without like paying 100$ worth of gas every other 3 weeks.

Read full topic

item.title: Obama
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

You seem to be under the assumption that the president of the US dictates the gas price. You seem to forget that the US is a country with a free market, which means that the price of commodities are set on the market. The price is a result of supply and demand. You live in a country where about 50% of it’s population sees this president as a socialist traitor. Socialism means a big government, socialism means that the government has a big(er) influence in the market. So if Obama ever said he would lower the gas prices, then he was lying. Any human being capable of reasoning should be able to figure that out himself.

I’m not a citizen of the US, so I don’t know all the ins and outs of Obama care. From what I understand of it, the government competes with other insurance companies, and everyone is forced to have a health insurance. I don’t know if that includes illegal citizens. Besides, you should see health care and illegality as to seperate things. The humane thing to do is taking care of anyone who needs health care, without checking if that person is a legal citizen.

Read full topic

item.title: Obama
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

such a troll

but for anyone out there who shares similar ignorant beliefs, the president cannot control gas prices and no energy policy changes (read: drill baby drill) will have any significant effect on gas prices, but considering for a minute if they did, gas is a globally traded commodity, you’d save a lot more selling it to another country than you would using it to reduce pump prices by a tiny bit

Read full topic
